templates.template:
$phpkd_chusrn_history_bits
$vbphrase[phpkd_chusrn_history]
$vbphrase[phpkd_chusrn_oldusername] $vbphrase[phpkd_chusrn_newusername] $vbphrase[phpkd_chusrn_action] $vbphrase[phpkd_chusrn_processedby] $vbphrase[phpkd_chusrn_request_dateline] $vbphrase[phpkd_chusrn_action_dateline] $vbphrase[phpkd_chusrn_comment]

$phpkd_chusrn_history_bit[oldusername] $phpkd_chusrn_history_bit[newusername] $phpkd_chusrn_history_bit[action] $processedby $phpkd_chusrn_history_bit[request_dateline] $phpkd_chusrn_history_bit[action_dateline] $phpkd_chusrn_history_bit[comment]

$vbphrase[phpkd_chusrn_edit_username]
$vbphrase[phpkd_chusrn_enter_password_to_continue]:
$vbphrase[phpkd_chusrn_edit_username]
$vbphrase[phpkd_chusrn_newusername]:
$vbphrase[phpkd_chusrn_confirm_new_username]:

$phpkd_chusrn_history

plugin.title: Username Change Manager [Member's Profile Username Logs]
Username Change Manager [UserCP Nav Cell Background]

phrasetype.name: Permissions
phrasetype.phrase: Can view others username change history
Can view own username change history
Force users to re-activate their accounts after username change<dfn>Note: this will work only if your setting "Verify Email address in Registration" is activated.</dfn>
Minimum posts required to change username
Minimum reputation points required to change username
Select the usergroup that you need to move the user to it after changing his/her username (See also the previous setting).

Type of moving that should affect user's sergroup. Select 'Primary Usergroup' to change the user's main usergroup to this group or select 'Additional Usergroups' to add this group to the user's additional usergroups when the user changes his/her username.
Note: This setting has no effect if the "Force users to re-activate their accounts after username change" setting is turned "On".
Minimum registration days must pass before username change

Period between simultaneous username changes<dfn>Enter '-1' for allowing username change for users any time (ignoring the waiting period), entering '0' will allow users to be able to change their username just once. Enter any other value (in days) to force users to wait this period before able to change their usernames.</dfn>

phrasetype.name: Control Panel User Management
phrasetype.phrase: Username change Log Viewer (page {1}/{2}) | There are {3} total log entries.

phrasetype.name: Email Body Text
phrasetype.phrase: Dear $username, Since you have recently changed your username, we require that you re-verify your account. You will only need to visit the url once to have your account updated. To complete reverification, please visit this url: $vboptions[bburl]/register.php?a=act&u=$userid&i=$activateid America Online Users Please Visit Here to be Activated **** Does The Above URL Not Work? **** If the above url does not work, please use your Web browser to go to: $vboptions[bburl]/register.php?a=ver Please to be sure not to add extra spaces. You will need to type in your username and activation number on the page that appears when you visit the url. Your Username is: $username Your Activation ID is: $activateid If you are still having problems verifying please contact a member of our support staff at $vboptions[webmasteremail] All the best, $vboptions[bbtitle] -------------------- To stop receiving this email, please visit this url: $vboptions[bburl]/register.php?do=deleteactivation&u=$userid&i=$activateid

Dear $username,
You have recently changed your username successfully at $vboptions[bbtitle], for more information please visit the forum at the following link: $vboptions[bburl]
If you have any questions, you can contact staff at $vboptions[webmasteremail]
All the best, $vboptions[bbtitle]

Dear $username,
You have recently requested username change at $vboptions[bbtitle], your request has been submitted to staff to be reviewed and processed. For more information please visit the forum at the following link: $vboptions[bburl]
If you have any questions, you can contact staff at $vboptions[webmasteremail]
All the best, $vboptions[bbtitle]

Hello,
$bbuserinfo[username] has changed his/her username at $vboptions[bbtitle], you can review and/or take the appropriate action from ADMINCP.
Regards $vboptions[bbtitle] $vboptions[bburl]

Hello,
$bbuserinfo[username] has requested a username change at $vboptions[bbtitle], you can review and/or take the appropriate action from ADMINCP.
Regards $vboptions[bbtitle] $vboptions[bburl]

phrasetype.name: Email Subject Text
phrasetype.phrase: Action Required to Verify Username Change at $vboptions[bbtitle]!
Your username has been changed at $vboptions[bbtitle]!
You have requested username change at $vboptions[bbtitle]!

phrasetype.name: Error Messages
phrasetype.phrase: Sorry, you don't have permission to change your username.
You should have {2} posts before you can change your username, you have now {1}.
You should have registered from {2} days before you can change your username, you have registered from {1} days.
You should have {2} reputation points before you can change your username, you have now {1}.
You should wait {2} days between each simultaneous username changes, you have waited {1} days.
No Log Entries Matched Your Query
The two usernames that you entered do not match.
That username was previously requested by another user and still in the waiting list, so you can't request it till staff take an action.
You have previously requested username change and that request still in the waiting list, you can't submit multiple requests. You should wait till staff take an action.
That username was previously denied by administration users, so you can't use it.
That username was previously used by another user & administration doesn't allow using of old used usernames.
You are currently using that username, please try a different one.

phrasetype.name: Front-End Redirect Messages
phrasetype.phrase: Thank you for updating your profile, $bbuserinfo[username]. You have successfully changed your username.
Thank you for updating your profile, $bbuserinfo[username].Your username change request has been submitted to staff to be reviewed and processed.

phrasetype.name: GLOBAL
phrasetype.phrase: Your username request has been denied!
Your username has been changed successfully!
Your have changed your username successfully!
You have changed your username successfully!
Your username change request has been sent to staff!
Username change request has been denied.
Account active and doesn't need re-verification.
Username change request in the waiting list.

phrasetype.name: User Tools (global)
phrasetype.phrase: Enter your present password to continue
The entered usernames do not match.
Please fill out both username fields.

phrasetype.name: vBulletin Settings
phrasetype.phrase: Turn this option "On" if you need to allow other users to request some denied usernames that administration have denied others to register with.

Turn this option "On" if you need to allow users to request old usernames for others (usernames that was used by others in the past & changed later by their owners), if this options turned "Off", users will not be able to request others old usernames, these old usernames will be denied also in new registrations.

Turn this option "On" if you need to allow users to request own old usernames (usernames that was used by the same user in the past & changed later), if this options turned "Off", users will not be able to request own old usernames, this options is useless when the previous options "Allow old usernames request" turned "On" & this option turned "Off".

Specify auto prune period for "username change logs" here (by days), all logs for username change before this older than this period will be deleted periodically. Note: Activating this options will result in ignoring the previous two "Allow denied usernames to others" & "Allow own old usernames request" for the pruned log intries since there will be no logs for them to check out.
Auto prune period for username change logs
Specify if you need to disable smilies in pm message or not. this depends on the pm text that you have created in the option up there.
Disable smilies in PM notify or not

Place here the iconid that you need to set for PM notify.
leave it blank or put "0" to ignore this option.
Specify if you need to override quota when sending PM notify or not.
Specify if you need or not to request a read receipt for the sent PM notify.
Request a read receipt for PM Notify
Specify if you need or not to save a copy of the sent PM notify in the sender's outbox.
Save copy of the sent PM notify in sender's outbox
Specify if you need or not to show the sender's signature in the sent PM notify.
Display signature or not In PM Notifications
Type here the username of the sender of "Action taken PM Notify" that will be sent to users notifying them for administration action taken towards their username change.
Type here the username of the sender of "Requests PM Notify" that will be sent to staff notifying them for usernames changes.
Select notification type for staff which will be sent when any user request username change.
Type here staff usernames that will receive "username change notifications", type them respectively separated with semicolon';'.
Select notification type for Users which will be sent to user when any administration take an action towards their "username change request".
